_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
HUSKER AG, LLC.

Husker Ag, L.L.C. began ethanol production on March 8, 2003 with a production capacity of approximately 20 million gallons per year.  Husker Ag is expanding its capacity to produce 60 million gallons per year.  Since the beginning there have been constant review and revisions to reports and information.

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

Husker Ag, LLC. has a commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated in the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel as well as considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facility.

Husker Ag, LLC.'s policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel are trained to activate remote shutoff valves and to follow the emergency response plan.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

Husker Ag, LLC. ethanol plant is located in Plainview, Pierce County, Nebraska

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substance under the RMP program is Anhydrous Ammonia. Husker Ag, LLC. has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 4.9 miles; due to amount of ammonia stored on site.

Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:

The worst case scenario at the facility is the release of all 75,600 pounds of ammonia creating a toxic cloud.  The worst-case scenario is based on the release of all ammonia stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 4.9 miles from the center of the plant.  Rural  residence homes are located within this 4.9 mile radius.

Although Husker Ag, LLC. has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative controls or passive mitiga

tion measures were taken into account in evaluating this scenario.

Since the facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, Process Safety Management has to be completed for this facility.

Five Year Accident History:

Husker Ag, LLC has been in operation since March 2003 and to date has had no accidents or releases to report.

Emergency Response Program Information:

The Husker Ag, LLC. ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan and SPCC plan for prevention of spills.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities.  Husker Ag, LLC's corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.

Husker Ag, LLC. conducts monthly and quarterly safety inspections as well as a thourough training programs to insure community safety.
